name: Will You Be There
wikiSummary: Will You Be There is a single from the Dangerous album. Recorded in 1991 and later released as a single in 1993. It is featured on the Free Willy motion picture and its soundtrack album. Michael Jackson also contributed a song to the sequel (Childhood). The track from the Dangerous album is over 7 minutes long, with a prelude of Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 in D Minor performed by the Cleveland Orchestra. Some later versions of the track are shorter and do not use the prelude.
wikiText: Will You Be There is a single from the Dangerous album. Recorded in 1991 and later released as a single in 1993. It is featured on the Free Willy motion picture and its soundtrack album. Michael Jackson also contributed a song to the sequel (Childhood). The track from the Dangerous album is over 7 minutes long, with a prelude of Beethoven's Symphony No. 9 in D Minor performed by the Cleveland Orchestra. Some later versions of the track are shorter and do not use the prelude. The track is featured on All Time Greatest Movie Songs, a compilation album of tracks from Aladdin, Free Willy, Simon Birch, Titanic and other motion pictures. The track won the MTV Movie Award for "Best Song in a Movie" in 1994. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
